headline: Double Layer Pumpkin Pie
description: This double layer pumpkin pie takes two dessert faves and layers them into one. Rich, creamy cheesecake or spiced pumpkin pie? You don't have to choose!
name: Double Layer Pumpkin Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can solid pack pumpkin puree
2 (3.5 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix

recipeInstructions.text: Pour milk for pumpkin layer into large bowl. Add pumpkin puree, pudding mix, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves and whisk until thoroughly mixed. Let sit until thickened, about 5 minutes.

Meanwhile, beat cream cheese, milk, and sugar for cheesecake layer in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Gently stir in whipped topping. Spoon into graham cracker crust and spread into an even layer.
Spread thickened pumpkin mixture over top. Cover and refrigerate until set, about 4 hours.

review.reviewBody: Very tasty and easy to make. No baking is an extra bonus. I also added a 1/4 tsp of nutmeg as my Mom always used that to her pumpkin pies!

Absolutely Brilliant. I made this for thanksgiving dinner, and it was AMAZING. Everyone loved it. Although, make sure to chill the crust before adding the first layer, and then chill it after adding the first layer to help prevent the layers from mixing. This recipe is insanely easy to make, and I would definitely recommend this to anyone.
This pie required a LOT of chilling, I ended up even freezing between the layers because it was a huge mess. But the flavor was good!

Wish I would have read the reviews before trying to put this together but I usually read the recipe first since I trust that it’s posted on here because it’s accurate. The cream cheese base turned out fine but the pudding mixture still hasn’t firmed up and now it’s Thanksgiving so I’m rushing around to try to fix this pie for my family coming over. This person needs to revise their recipe so this doesn’t happen to anyone else.

It was easy to make.
I added a little vanilla extract to the bottom layer and used light cream cheese and light sour cream (1/3 cup).

I omitted the cloves from the top layer.
One of the favorites in our home and easy to make
I love this pie I just wish it would not get runny the next day
Make it again
This is my holiday favorite. It is more cheesecake than pumpkin pie so more people will eat it. I make 4 at the same time and it is so easy.
I make this exact recipe every Thanksgiving. I don’t have to change a thing about it. My son loves this. He tells me it’s not Thanksgiving without my pumpkin pie.
I've made this pie for years ago until I lost my recipe. Was a family favorite. I'm so happy to have it again!
No changes and plan on having it for thanksgiving. No baking. YEAH
No changes and plan on having it for thanksgiving. No baking. YEAH
Awesome and easy. Everyone loves it

I actually came across this recipe years ago. My husband and I aren't fans of regular pumpkin pie and so this was a great find. Every time I make it, people go crazy for it. The only change I make is to add a smidge more spices than the recipe calls for. Note: The filling is enough to actually to fill a Keebler Extra Serving pie crust. Also, the pumpkin cream layer can be made a day in advance in order to allow the flavors some time to meld.
This is my go to pumpkin pie recipe for the holidays.
Add the pudding mix last!!! It's the thickening agent!

I have been making this at Thanksgiving for over 10 years now. Everyone looks forward to it, wouldn't be Thanksgiving without it. It's embarrassingly easy to make, no baking which is a plus around the holidays. I make it exactly as the recipe says.
Be sure the read the instructions first. They didn't add the milk needed in the recipe for the pumpkin layer.
Mushy, like pudding.
This is my all-time favorite pumpkin pie recipe. Soooo easy and delicious!
Not allowed to have a holiday without this!! :D

Very good pie - the family really liked it. Light, fluffy texture. I used a gingersnap crust which is good with pumpkin. The second time I made it I used cream instead of milk in the pumpkin layer and that made it a little denser than I like so I won't be doing that again. I'll stick withe the original recipe.
Delicious and super easy to make

I made this recipe and the flavor is fabulous. I changed only one thing- I used fresh pumpkin instead of canned. So if you plan on doing the same, there's one thing you need to know. Fresh pumpkin has much more liquid in it than canned. Which will make the second layer of this pie not firm up. You'll have pumpkin soup instead of pie. So it's easy enough to buy a couple slightly larger boxes of instant pudding. Opt for the 5 ounce size instead of the 3 ounce one.
next time I may add a little more cream cheese, a little less whipped topping, and a little more stevia for my preference of sweetness and consistency. Everyone liked it, no left overs.

I have no idea how all this is supposed to fit in a 9 inch pie crust. The first time I made it, I followed the instructions and ended up with a bunch of leftover filling. This time I did not add 1 1/2 cups of whipped topping to the cream cheese mixture. Instead I only mixed the cream cheese, sugar, and milk together, placed it in the crust, and spread a thin layer of whipped topping over that. I put that in the freezer for a few hours, then mixed the pumpkin with the remaining ingredients and spread it over all. I refrigerated that until time to eat, and then added the whipped topping on the individual slices. It worked much better this way.

It turned out really good! I tweaked the recipe a bit: I used 8 oz of cream cheese, fresh ginger instead of powdered, and refrigerated between the cream cheese filling and the pumkin filling. People loved it. Some of my friends who typically don't like pumpkin pie, loved this one! I am so happy with this recipe, and will be using it again every year!

I have made this pie for 15+ years. I don't even remember where I found the recipe. I found that taking the time to make my own whipped cream, instead of using Cool Whip or other prepared cream, makes it the best. I've never had a problem with the layers mixing - the worst that happens is that sometimes the milk is TOO cold and it makes it hard to whisk the lumps out of the pudding. Also don't cut corners on softening the cream cheese, and whipped cream cheese won't work.
I've made this pie for every holiday for the last ten years. Huge hit every time!
I have made it without the bottom layer and put cool whip on top. Much better than pumpkin pie you bake.

I have made this pie for over 20 years because my family doesn't believe the holidays would be able to go on without it. It is simple and delicious. Perfect for the person who doesn't normally like pumpkin pie. I have never had anyone dislike this pie.

I was looking for something more exciting than plain old heavy, dense pumpkin pie. This was perfect, and so easy! I sprinkled some chopped pecans with cinnamon & sugar and toasted them in the oven for 15 min at 325, then sprinkled some on top of crust before adding cream cheese layer. Then I chilled that for 30 min before adding pumpkin layer, and sprinkled more pecans on top. Refrigerated overnight and it was totally awesome!!

To make this 5 stars and the layers not blend together, I got one small box of the vanilla cook and serve pudding and made as directed and then mixed in my canned pumpkin with 2 Tbsp of powdered sugar and the called for spices and set aside. For the whipped cream and cheese layer, I omitted the milk and added 1-2 tbsp powder sugar to it. Then layer and chill. You don't have to chill it as long this way either. Loved it!

I just made this for Thanksgiving and it was a huge hit. The best comment was "I normally don't really like pumpkin pie, but I love this pie!" What makes this recipe different is how light and creamy it is. I also substituted ginger snaps for the crust.
this has been my families favorite pie for 5 years now. Thank you so much for this recipe... i wish i could give it more than 5 stars. cudos
Made it exactly like the recipe, delicious!!!!
Made this with sungirl's modifications (thank you sungirl!). Made own crust from crushed pecan sandies cookies. A favorite year after year!

I've made this pie for about the past 10 years. My family likes it and it's an easy alternative to traditional pumpkin pie. The best tip I have is to use the larger graham cracker crust (Keebler 2 Extra Servings) because the amount of filling spills over the 9 inch crust.

I made this pie today and it was great! I used a shortbread crum pie shell instead of the graham and it made it taste even lighter. I used whipping cream from a carton and only used but a teaspoon of sugar When mix it. I have to watch my sugar in take and this was light and wonderful.

Other tips were extremely helpful.... time well spent to review them. Modifications were nutmeg for ginger sub, and 3/4 c. milk sub. Using ten inch pie crust will give you normal, bottom layer but thin tip layer, but still very good. Chill overnight to give sufficient structure. Tough to please father-in-law said I could almost quite my day job. That sealed the deal for me.
I added butterscotch pudding instead of vanilla. It's such a light and not very sweet dessert. My husband loved it! Ate half the pie himself

Pretty easy and straight forward to make, even with making my own graham cracker crust. My only thing I found was that was quite sweet.. so I'd increase the cream cheese and reduce the whipped topping for the bottom layer.
I make this pie all the time and everyone loves it!

Not a bad recipe to try as a change up from the traditional baked pumpkin pie I usually eat during the holidays. Since I usually drown my traditional pumpkin pie with whipped cream, this recipe hits the mark for me. I like the fact that it is not baked. Easy to make too.
The bottom layer was tart.
Yes and its delicious!! And very easy to make!!! Enjoyed making it with my helper Autumn Raymond!!
This is an easy and good pie. I made it just as directed. I might try adding a little more cream cheese, sugar, and milk to the bottom layer.
When I made this I ended up going to an oversized regular pie crust. I also put a layer of almond paste between (for a triple layer pie) and a pretty design of slivered almonds on top.
I had a rather unimpressive experience with this.
Made this for Thanksgiving this year and we loved it! Pretty easy and it didn't take up the oven when I needed to use it for so many other dishes. Will definitely make again.

I tweaked this recipe quite a bit based on other reviewers comments. I used 8 oz cream cheese,2 tbsp sugar, the topping as listed, and no milk. Chilled the store bought crust, then put the first layer in then put the pie in the freezer while fixing the second layer. The second layer I started with half of the pumpkin and half and half - not milk, then played to get a good texture.... ended up with 3/4 can pumpkin, the 2 packages of vanilla pudding, 1 tsp vanilla, a 1/2 to 2/3 cup of half and half, 2 tsp cinnamon, and 1/2-3/4 tsp nutmeg, plus a couple of globs of whipped cream topping. This made a nice spreadable but thick layer with a spicy pumpkin taste. Brought it to the office, told folks it was in the fridge, and I have been stopped repeatedly with compliments. I have been told I have to make it again for Christmas... :) Not really cheesecake, not pudding, I called it pumpkin cream pie.
so creamy and not too sweet. I used fresh pumpkin that I had roasted the day before. The small pumpkin yielded enough to make 3 pies. I'll be making this one again.
Yummy!

I was looking for a cream cheese/pumpkin pie and was thrilled to find this. I brought it in for a pot luck and it was a hit. I used french vanilla instant pudding though. My husband loves it and I am sure I will be making it again. The fact that is is a no bake pie and can be made in advance with no worries, even better. I did bake the crust for 8 minutes just to firm it up. I have had them crumble and fall apart in the past.
Yes, we have tried it; my bride makes it every year at Thanksgiving as one of the dessert choices and it's absolutely delicious.

I have been making this recipe for at least 15 years! It's always such a hit! I usually have to make 2 pies since 1 is never enough, they always want more! Great tips on here in the reviews....my tip is that I use "french Vanilla" flavored pudding, adds a little extra yumminess to it & I also always get the graham cracker crust that says "2 extra servings", it gives the pie fillings a little extra room to settle into! I also add a little nutmeg to the spices, but shhh, don't tell anyone!!;)

Have been using this recipe for many, many years! Agree that once the cream cheese and whipping cream base is mixed that you refrigerate it for at least an hour prior to adding the pumpkin layer. Also will add -- 3.25% homogenized milk and 1 3/4 cups of pumpkin filling works well in this recipe which will give you more than enough if using a pre-made 9" graham cracker pie shell. As you will have excess filling left over use it to make at least ten to twelve small pastry tarts. 
Tarts: Bake first and let cool. As you will need extra cream cheese filling; cut ingredients in half and prepare the same way as you did for the pie. Line baked tarts with the mixture and refrigerate. Add excess pumpkin layer on top. Refrigerate as well until use.

I followed the recipe exactly. The cream cheese layer made this a unique pie for Thanksgiving. Not your traditional pumpkin pie. I was asked for the recipe by several people. Best compliment you can receive!

Made the recipe exactly the way it was written. It turned out really good! 2nd time around I tweaked the recipe. First I doubled the recipe. I used sweat potatoe pie filling instead of pumpkin. By using sweat potatoe pie filling I didn't need to add the rest of the spices because it was already in there. Instead of boring old graham crackers for the crust I used a whole pack of sandies cookies ( shortbread) and crushed it then added half stick of butter and firmly pressed it on a 9x13 pan. I will be making this again!
i didn't enjoy it, thought it had a weird flavor to it. but some of my guests loved it.
I made this for Thanksgiving two years ago, I don't happen to care for it , HOWEVER everyone else that was there that night LOVED it and now request it 2-3x per year. It is easy, which is a plus.

My 17 year old son told me I was a pie making magician when he tasted this! Make sure you read some of the other modifications from other reviewers... I used 1 tbsp of chilled evaporated milk in addition to the 1 tbsp of half and half (instead of the called for milk) in the bottom layer to make it more solid. I also substituted half and half for the called for regular milk in the top pumpkin layer. Next time I'll probably use a little evaporated milk in the top layer, too, to make it a bit more dense. I also made my own graham cracker crust - which I think is much tastier than the store bought. This pie will be a new favorite at holiday dinners... we loved it!!

GET 2 PIE CRUSTS! NOT ONE! I have one HEAPING pie in my fridge right now and figured I'd let others know who might be making this for Thanksgiving that it will mix up enough for TWO normal 9 inch pies. If you are concerned, get 2 8 inch pies. I piled in as much as I could and still had like 2 or 3 scoops of each mix and the pie is like 2 1/2 inches above the crust! Lol! Tasted AWESOME from the tastes everyone snuck!

My mom first came across this recipe when I was little, either in a magazine or an insert in a graham cracker crust(it was so long ago that I can't remember which). It has become a Thanksgiving staple in my family. It's the ABSOLUTE BEST PUMPKIN PIE RECIPE.

This recipe is perfect the way it is. Just make sure you chill the crust and then chill each layer. My younger cousin has requested me to make this as her birthday cake as she loved it so much. HUGE hit with everyone.
Everyone loved it

I read all the reviews and there were alot of mixed reviews. I did all the things people said to do, to make the pie better. I froze the pie in between layers, used less milk, and after 8 hours in the fridge, the pumkin layer was still runny!! I don't know how you keep it from this, but I will not be using this recipe again.

I give this recipe two stars because of taste which was ok, however the pumpkin mixture was kind of lumpy and it definitely needs to be refrigerated for at least 48 hours in order to serve a slice of pie otherwise you end up with a pile of pie.

I am not aloud to enter my family's house on Thanksgiving without 2 of these in tow!LOL! I do however use "French Vanilla" instant Pudding in place of plain vanilla & I also add a bit of "nutmeg" along with the other spices...both add a little bit extra flavoring to this easy to make & already delicious recipe!! YUM!! :o)

Great pumpkin pie recipe. I used one package or vanilla pudding and one package of pumpkin pudding thats always in the stores this time of year. I think I will try reducing the milk to 3/4 cup so it sets firmer. I also took the 4 oz of cream cheese and beat it together with 1/2 C confect sugar then in another bowl I beat 1/2 cup heavy cream to a whipped cream consistency. Then folded that into the cream cheese mixture . spread it into the pie shell and chilled it first before adding the pumpkin filling mixture.

I would like to note that this was created long ago in some test kitchen. I have been making this pie since I was 10 years old (1990). My mom and I found the recipe in a Family Circle. It is a hit though and everyone loves it.
This recipe was okay, but nothing special. Won't make again.
My family loves this! Even the ones who don't like pumpkin pie!
Everyone liked this.

Ok LOVE this pie. The modifications are 8oz of cream cheese and 2 Tb sugar with no milk (along w the whipped topping). Freeze it after first layer for about 10 min. Put 3/4 cup cold evaporated milk. and 1 and 2/3 packages of vanilla pudding mix. Then mix it together until smooth. Then put 3/4 of the 15 oz can of pumpkin in it(not cup the can). Put 1/4-1/2 t pumpkin pie spice. and 1/4-1/2 t cinnamon. Do this and your pie will be perfect. Not runny or too sweet, not too much filling and will taste pretty much like pumpkin pie. For the rest of the pudding mix and canned pumpkin you probably could make a mouse out of it but haven't tried it. Just saying.

I made this last November for Thanksgiving, and it was really, really good. I think I accidentally added either too much whipped topping or too much cream cheese, but it still turned out really good. I will definitely be making this again next year. Besides that mistake, the only thing I did differently was making my own graham cracker crust because it's so easy (you just melt some butter, mix it with graham cracker crumbs, and bake for a few minutes), and I find that most of the premade crusts taste like cardboard.

My family, who "does not like pumpkin pie", LOVES this recipe. I just made a couple of changes...I used a full 8oz bar of 1/3 fat cream cheese. I added about a tsp of Vanilla and a little extra sugar to the cream cheese/cool whip mixture. I used all spice and ginger for the spices in the pumpkin mixture. Additionally, I added 2 "globs" of cool whip to the pumpkin mixture. It makes it alot fluffier and a little sweeter.

I made this for my son who is allergic to eggs and nuts. The whole family raved about it. Even better than the apple pie for Thanksgiving dessert! I made it two weekends later, and it received the same reviews. Very creamy and tasty.
Kids said this was the best pumpkin pie ever. Must be the combination of the pumpkin and cream cheese layer. I went through two pies in the blink of an eye.

I made pumpkin pies for a dinner and a had a little bit of pie mixture left over. So I made a regular baked pumpkin pie that was lacking in fullness and when it was cooled I topped it with the cream cheese mixture. It was delicious and loved by everyone in the family.
very, very good. The spices made the pie so yummy! It's like upside-down pumpkin pie!

I made this pie for dessert on Thanksgiving. It turned out really well and tasted good. Everyone who had a slice thought it was good. Very easy to make. I did take the advice of the other reviewer and put it in the freezer to firm up the bottom layer.

It is so easy to make and taste great! I chilled each layer separately and use 8 oz pkg of cream cheese, a whole tub of whipped topping, 2 large pudding mix boxes and the large can of libby's pumpkin pie mix, saves money and already comes with the spices. It makes enough for 2 pies, one for our extended family's thankgiving gathering and kept one for my family. Everyone loves this pie!
Love the recipe. I have it requested every Thanksgiving.

Made this recipe for Thanksgiving. It was really, really sweet. I expected it to taste more like a traditional pumpkin pie, but it was more like a very sweet pumpkin and whipped cream pudding. I did refridgerate the bottom layer before adding the top layer and the layers stayed perfectly separated.

I made this for our family Thanksgiving. I decided that instead of a traditional graham cracker crust I was going to use Snickerdoodles in a blender and add some additional spices. Everyone RAVED about the pie. SO simple I will definitely make it again! Thank you!

I make this pie every Thanksgiving and everyone loves it. I've never had to chill each layer separately for it to turn out delicious. The only thing I change is the cloves. I use nutmeg instead. Be sure to use a 9oz crust because the pie is thick and you get more slices.

This is an amazing recipe! I am 14 years old and love cooking. This is easy for younger children to make and help make. My entire family enjoys this each thanksgiving and my aunts wishes I'd make it on Christmas too. It very simple to memorize, and fun.

I made this for my family last night and it got rave reviews. It is so easy to make, and everyone thought I slaved over the stove. I will make this again and again, it was just delicious. I did chill before each layer, and had no problems with the layers staying separate. It looked as good as it tasted!
For an even spicier festive flavor, try using the seasonal pumpkin spice pudding mix (and add a tsp of vanilla extract) instead of vanilla pudding flavor.

I have been making this for the past 6 years. Every year I have to make more and more pies. I am up to 10 pies this year all for family. Thank goodness it's an easy no bake recipe. We LOVE LOVE LOVE this pie!

This is my family's favorite pumpkin pie recipe! I have made it for 10 years. My 2 teenage boys ask for it every holiday season. I can not bake anything, but this pie is so easy to make. It is a twist on the traditional baked pie. I only use 1/2 cup of milk on the pumpkin/pudding layer. I use allspice instead of the suggested spices (just add to your liking). Like other reviewers, I also recomend mixing the milk with the pudding first and then add in the pumpkin. I like the pie served cold out of the refridgerator.

I got this same recipe from my mother in law a few years ago. This is my kids' favorite pie. This recipe is exactly the same as the one from my mother in law except for one step. Instead of mixing the milk, pudding, pumpkin and spices together all at once my version calls for mixing the milk and pudding together first. Beat with wire wisk for 2 minutes. Then let it stand for 3 minutes. Now add the pumkin and spices, mixing well. I've never had a problem with my pie being runny as some other reviewers complained about. Changing this step may solve that problem.

This was soo good. Everyone loved it. I bought 2 pie crust since other reviewers said it makes enough for 2. I disagree. I think it makes enough for one stacked pie. I also put the pumpkin layer on the bottom then the cool whip mixture. I also used evaporated milk instead of regular milk. Will def. make again and again. Very easy considering there is no baking involved.
This is an amazing recipe. I made it for a church gathering and everyone loved it!! My favorite pumpkin pie definitely. :)
Simply delicious!

I give this a 4 as written, but I give my version a 5. have made it the regular way, using 3/4 c. of milk and it's perfect. I use a large graham cracker crust and sprinkle finely cut, toasted pecans over the crust. For the spices I use cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg - no ginger. I also add in about 1/2 tsp. of vanilla extract to the pumpkin mixture. Now.... I have also made this almost sugar free. I use a graham cracker crust, sprinkle finely cut, toasted pecans over the crust. I use SF pudding, SF whipped topping, and 4 pkgs. of sweetner in place of the sugar. Excellent!
I liked how easy this recipe was to make! I took the remaining whipped topping and added it to the pumpkin mixture for a little extra "fluff" YUM!
